line_1: Shall hapless from the cup delusion sip,
line_2: Whoe'er un'wares shall ply his thirsty lip,

line_1: Nor let the blasting spoiler sip.
line_2: The fragrance of thy balmy lip!

line_1: And what the changeful fleeting crowd, who sip
line_2: The unhonoured beverage with contemptuous lip,
Sweet as nectar to my lip.

line_1: Who, mindless of the Feasting, went to sip
line_2: The balmy Pleasure of the Shepherd's Lip.

line_1: No sweet dew of love from these roses I sip,
line_2: Oh! where is the sweetness that dwells on that lip?

line_1: Boasting, while cans of cheering grog they sip,
line_2: The varied fortunes of "our gallant ship:"

line_1: Gay China's nymphs from pictur'd vases sip;
line_2: Each leaf, whose fragrant steam with ruby lip
And lip in rapture glued to lip;

line_1: Ere I the magic draught could sip;
line_2: She turn'd it from my eager lip.

line_1: Of which we guests so fondly sip,
line_2: Handing the cup to Hope's sweet lip,

line_1: Taught from thy sparkling cup full joys to sip,
line_2: And suck sweet poison from thy velvet lip,

line_1: The thrilling joy he would for ever sip,
line_2: Then, with sweet pressure of her rosy lip,

line_1: That slumbering thus unconscious she may sip
line_2: A placid smile plays o'er each roseate lip,
